text: SECOND MESSENGERS (Signal Transduction Pathways) Hormones are considered as first messengers that bind with the receptors. The hormone (or the ligand) binding with receptors forms the complex called hormone-recep- tor (HR) complex. Formation of HR complex is the first step in the hormone action that eventually leads to forma- tion of second messengers. In general, the processes of second messenger forma- tion are broadly categorized into 4 types (Table 53.2): 1. Activation of ion channels 2. Activation of G proteins
